message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public static <T extends Number> double sum(Iterable<T> iterable) {
    double sum = 0;
    for (T t : iterable) {
        sum += t.doubleValue();
    }
    return sum;
}
<<<explanation>>>: In Java, you can't use operators like += on generic types because Java doesn't know at compile time what specific type T is. Instead, you can use the doubleValue() method which is defined in the Number class and overridden in all its subclasses. This method returns the value of the number as a double, which can be used with the += operator. This solution will work for all subclasses of Number, including Integer, Double, and Long.
